intro: Discladium koenigii, commonly known as the Indian bay leaf or tejpatta, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, elliptical leaves that are widely used in cooking. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are harvested when young and tender, and they emit a strong, spicy aroma due to the presence of essential oils. The botanical features of Discladium koenigii make it a valuable species in both culinary and medicinal contexts.
